description: In this module, students will examine how various literary texts are adapted into films. They will do so by interrogating how directorial techniques, institutional constraints and related socio-cultural contexts inform adaptations. Specifically, students will watch and analyse cinematic adaptations of plays, short stories, and comics to bring to the surface how aesthetic elements ranging from mise-en-scene to socio-cultural factors influence filmmakers and studiosâ€™ motivations. In the process, students will develop a systematic approach in carrying out a critique of adapted films they enjoy.
title: Print to Screen: Analysing Film Adaptation
prerequisite: Students must have passed/been exempted from the NUS Qualifying English Test (QET) or have passed CELC English for Academic Purposes modules.
